", '\xa0 ', 'Become a data and analytics evangelist:\xa0The data engineer will be considered a blend of data and analytics “evangelist,” “data guru” and “fixer.” This role will promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals ', 'Demonstrated success\xa0in working with large, heterogeneous datasets to extract business value using tools such as AWS Data Pipeline, Airflow or Segment to reduce or even automate parts of the tedious data preparation tasks. ', 'Monitoring schema changes. ', 'Education and Training', 'Strong experience\xa0in working with data science teams in refining and optimizing data science and machine learning models and algorithms. ', 'Educate and train:\xa0The data engineer should be curious and knowledgeable about new data initiatives and how to address them. This includes applying their data and/or domain understanding in addressing new data requirements. They will also be responsible for proposing appropriate and innovative data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques in optimally addressing these data requirements. The data engineer will be required to train counterparts such as data analysts, business users or any data consumers in these data pipelining and preparation techniques, which make it easier for them to integrate and consume the data they need for their own use cases. ', 'Our client is seeking an energetic and collaborative Data Engineer who can help instantiate and advocate for our data foundation practice at the bank. ', 'Strong experience in profiling source data with little or no documentation and documenting data quality ', 'At least three years of', 'Participate in ensuring compliance and governance during data use', 'Build data pipelines:\xa0 \xa0Manage data pipelines consisting of a series of stages through which data flows (for example, from data sources or endpoints of acquisition to integration to consumption for specific use cases). These data pipelines have to be created, maintained and optimized as workloads move from development to production for specific use cases. Architecting, creating and maintaining data pipelines will be the primary responsibility of the data engineer. Drive Automation through effective metadata management: The data engineer will be responsible for using innovative and modern tools, techniques and architectures to partially or completely automate the most-common, repeatable and tedious data preparation and integration tasks in order to minimize manual and error-prone processes and improve productivity. The data engineer will also need to assist with renovating the data management infrastructure to drive automation in data integration and management.Learning and using modern data preparation, integration and AI-enabled metadata management tools and techniques. Tracking data consumption patterns. Performing intelligent sampling and caching. Monitoring schema changes. Recommending — or sometimes even automating — existing and future integration flows. Collaborate across departments: The newly hired data engineer will need strong collaboration skills in order to work with varied stakeholders within the organization. In particular, the data engineer will work in close relationship with the data architect and with business (data) analysts in refining their data requirements for various data and analytics initiatives and their data consumption requirements. Educate and train:\xa0The data engineer should be curious and knowledgeable about new data initiatives and how to address them. This includes applying their data and/or domain understanding in addressing new data requirements. They will also be responsible for proposing appropriate and innovative data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques in optimally addressing these data requirements. The data engineer will be required to train counterparts such as data analysts, business users or any data consumers in these data pipelining and preparation techniques, which make it easier for them to integrate and consume the data they need for their own use cases. Participate in ensuring compliance and governance during data use: Data engineers should work with data governance team and data stewards within this team and participate in vetting and promoting content created in the business and by data architects to the curated data catalog for governed reuse. Become a data and analytics evangelist:\xa0The data engineer will be considered a blend of data and analytics “evangelist,” “data guru” and “fixer.” This role will promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals ', 'Learning and using modern data preparation, integration and AI-enabled metadata management tools and techniques. Our client is building the expertise to deliver leading, digital solutions for our consumer, small business, and commercial customers. Strong ability\xa0to design, build and manage data pipelines for data structures encompassing data transformation, data models, schemas, metadata and workload management. job_title: Software Engineer ( C++ Algorithmic trading, Low Latency )
job_text: ['', 'Experience of working on low latency and high-performance applications', 'With live roles in New York and Chicago this is a great opportunity for ambitious technologists who constantly challenge themselves and seek personal and professional development through high-impact projects.\xa0', 'Unix/Linux', 'Elite High Frequency Trading firms in the world is seeking for the brightest software engineers to join their special projects teams working on front-office trading infrastructure to develop and maintain high frequency stategies along with quants and researchers while optimizing the performance of trading algorithms. While the firm operates in Linux/Unix with a codebase written primarily in C++ and Python, If you are not a C++ or Python or Linux expert, that’s probably OK as long as have the appropriate technical fundamentals, practical experience and desire to quicly hit the ground running and develop. That being said, we want someone who is familiar with a non-scripting language such as C++ or Java.', 'A degree (Bachelors or Masters) in Computer Science is highly preferred but not essential', 'Desired', 'Excellent OO programming skills in C++Experience of working on low latency and high-performance applicationsUnix/LinuxA degree (Bachelors or Masters) in Computer Science is highly preferred but not essential', 'Compensation is the best in the market.', '\xa0', 'We expect candidates to have a minimum of 1 year of full-time work experience from a top tier tech company and a degree (Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD) preferably in Computer Science. Background in Finance is a plus but not a must. The pasition is not suitable for recent grads.', 'Excellent OO programming skills in C++']

['', 'The ability to balance individual work with working with teams in a startup environment', 'Strong SQL or Python skills', 'High motivation, work ethic, and self-discipline to organize and complete tasks\xa0', 'The willingness to learn and teach', 'Presented findings, insights and analytical results to internal partners for client deliveries, as well as the larger DS function for continued growth and learning', 'Our people are the center of our success. We are a smart, supportive team with diverse perspectives and a shared passion for fixing what’s broken in healthcare. It’s fun, challenging and important. Join us!', 'At Komodo Health, we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. Komodo Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.', 'Good understanding of how analytics insights tie into business goals', 'At Komodo Health, our mission is to reduce the global burden of disease. Smarter use of data is essential to this mission. We combine the world’s most comprehensive view of patient encounters with innovative algorithms and decades of clinical expertise to power our Healthcare Map, the industry’s most precise view of the U.S. healthcare system. With the Healthcare Map as our foundation, we offer a suite of powerful software applications that deliver exceptional value to the industry.', 'The Opportunity at Komodo Health', 'Incorporated a good understanding of the healthcare datasets at Komodo and client use-cases to effectively partner with data engineering teams for architectural decisions.', 'Delivered high-value data analytics projects that existing data products cannot cover.\xa0Worked with Product to help prototype new analytics offeringsEffectively partnered with customer-facing teams to reconcile client requirements with the capabilities of datasets available at KH.Incorporated a good understanding of the healthcare datasets at Komodo and client use-cases to effectively partner with data engineering teams for architectural decisions.Created a plan with the team to scale our solutions, automate code and centralize complex logic. Advocate for good practices within the team.Presented findings, insights and analytical results to internal partners for client deliveries, as well as the larger DS function for continued growth and learning', 'We Breathe Life Into Data', 'Delivered high-value data analytics projects that existing data products cannot cover.\xa0', 'Created a plan with the team to scale our solutions, automate code and centralize complex logic. Advocate for good practices within the team.', 'Keen analytical skillsStrong SQL or Python skillsThe willingness to learn and teachThe ability to balance individual work with working with teams in a startup environmentGood understanding of how analytics insights tie into business goalsHigh motivation, work ethic, and self-discipline to organize and complete tasks\xa0', 'Effectively partnered with customer-facing teams to reconcile client requirements with the capabilities of datasets available at KH.', 'Our Life Sciences Services group is looking for a Data Scientist to help build analytics pipelines and complex logic for complicated data projects that solve tangible customer use cases.\xa0 Our team’s mission is to support Life Science customers and products through custom applications of our healthcare map along with actionable insights, that enable Komodo to meet our business goals.', 'Worked with Product to help prototype new analytics offerings', 'Looking back on your first 12 months at Komodo Health, you will have…', 'What you bring to Komodo:', 'Keen analytical skills']

job_text: ['', 'Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law. ', '\xa0 ', 'You work well with non-engineers. You can lead a conversation in a room with designers, engineers, and product managers. You are comfortable with ambiguity. You have a strong sense of ownership, and are able to drive development of new projects and features to completion. You are comfortable working at all levels of the stack. ', 'Familiarity      with web-based platforms (Angular, React, HTML, CSS,      Javascript/Typescript) ', 'Ability      to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment ', 'Strong      experience in at least one high level programming language (Java, Python,      Go, C#) ', ' 3+      years of experience shipping software  Ability      to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment  Strong      grasp of Computer Science concepts (data structures, algorithms, and      programming paradigms)  Strong      experience in at least one high level programming language (Java, Python,      Go, C#)  Familiarity      with web-based platforms (Angular, React, HTML, CSS,      Javascript/Typescript)  ', 'Strong      grasp of Unix-like operating systems ', '3+      years of experience shipping software ', ' Experience      in a start-up environment  Experience      designing and implementing distributed systems and REST API interfaces  Strong      grasp of Unix-like operating systems  ', 'Please send your resume to Katie.Clayman@oracle.com', 'These are exciting times in our space - we are growing fast, still at an early stage, and working on ambitious new initiatives. From a technology perspective, this is a greenfield development environment with a huge amount of autonomy, leaving us free to build and innovate without being encumbered by legacy products and services. ', 'Experience      in a start-up environment ', 'Interested candidates should send resumes directly to: Katie.clayman@oracle.com ', ' ', 'As an engineer on our team, you will be involved in the design, development, and release of software to help plan, deliver and scale our data centers. You’ll be building novel backend systems, RESTful web services and rich user interfaces. You care about creating usable, useful software that solves real problems and brings delight to users. You have solid communication skills. You can clearly explain complex technical concepts. ', 'Experience      designing and implementing distributed systems and REST API interfaces ', 'Strong      grasp of Computer Science concepts (data structures, algorithms, and      programming paradigms) ', 'Minimum Qualifications: ', 'Preferred Qualifications: ']

job_title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning, Planning & Measurement
job_text: ['', 'Able to multitask and be a great teammate', 'Basic Qualifications', 'Expertise with R and/or Python', 'Use models to address key growth challenges and provide relevant insights on problems such as cross-channel optimization, market/individual level response modeling, targeting optimization, propensity modeling, uplift modeling, etc', 'Hunger and drive to learn complex topics', 'Work with cross-functional teams to implement and deploy models and improve analytical solutions by providing data-driven recommendations', 'Relevant work experience in applying advanced analytics or data science to marketing problems', 'Build tools and products that will optimize each part of the marketing funnel (from prospecting to sign up to early user to active user and churn), as well as to support budget planning, measurement, attribution, targeting, cross-sell/up-sell, paid channel optimization, and segmentation for core Uber businesses globally', '3+ years of working experience as a data scientistRelevant work experience in applying advanced analytics or data science to marketing problemsPrevious experience in advertising tech (e.g. market response modeling, forecasting, attribution, targeting, 3rd party data integration, and etc) is a plusExperience with big data using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, and Spark a plusStrong communication skillsOrganized and have the ability to balance attention to detail with swift executionAble to multitask and be a great teammateHunger and drive to learn complex topicsPassion for Uber!', 'Minimum 1 year of working experience as a data scientistExpertise with R and/or PythonAdvanced SQL skills - comfortable working with very large data setsExperience with machine learning techniques and advanced analytics (e.g. regression, classification, clustering, time series, econometrics, causal inference, mathematical optimization)', "What You'll Do", 'Use large scale data processing such as Spark, Hive, and Uber’s proprietary machine learning platform, and more', '3+ years of working experience as a data scientist', 'Build production grade models on large-scale datasets to optimize marketing performance by utilizing advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques and marketing science research', 'Build production grade models on large-scale datasets to optimize marketing performance by utilizing advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques and marketing science researchUse models to address key growth challenges and provide relevant insights on problems such as cross-channel optimization, market/individual level response modeling, targeting optimization, propensity modeling, uplift modeling, etcWork with cross-functional teams to implement and deploy models and improve analytical solutions by providing data-driven recommendationsUse large scale data processing such as Spark, Hive, and Uber’s proprietary machine learning platform, and moreCollaborate with marketing leadership, design, product and engineering teamsParticipate in project planning/prioritization meetings, partner meetings, data prioritization meetings, etcBuild tools and products that will optimize each part of the marketing funnel (from prospecting to sign up to early user to active user and churn), as well as to support budget planning, measurement, attribution, targeting, cross-sell/up-sell, paid channel optimization, and segmentation for core Uber businesses globally', 'Organized and have the ability to balance attention to detail with swift execution', 'Advanced SQL skills - comfortable working with very large data sets', 'Experience with big data using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, and Spark a plus', 'About The Role', 'Experience with machine learning techniques and advanced analytics (e.g. regression, classification, clustering, time series, econometrics, causal inference, mathematical optimization)', 'Previous experience in advertising tech (e.g. market response modeling, forecasting, attribution, targeting, 3rd party data integration, and etc) is a plus', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Passion for Uber!', 'Minimum 1 year of working experience as a data scientist', 'Participate in project planning/prioritization meetings, partner meetings, data prioritization meetings, etc', 'Strong communication skills', 'Collaborate with marketing leadership, design, product and engineering teams']

with minimal oversight, documentation, and defined process.', 'Passionate about data accuracy and consistency for financial use cases.', 'A strong understanding of dimensional warehouse data models is necessary.']

['Proven software engineering skills in C++ and/or Python ', 'Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in both what we research and how we perform our research our goal is to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries PhD degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! ', 'Beneficial: Experience with autonomous vehicles, robot path planning ', 'You are passionate about applying machine learning to real-world problems in autonomous driving and about building the required frameworks and tools to do so. You will interact closely with our ml and data teams to design, use and deploy maintainable infrastructure for training and inference. ', 'Beneficial: Experience with computer vision and multiview geometry. ', 'Help create new deep learning approaches and apply them to solve a plethora of real-world problems, such as driver intent prediction, agent prediction, etc. ', 'Hands-on experience with cloud frameworks such as AWS, GCP or Azure ', 'You will work alongside top research scientists in machine learning and probabilistic robotics to develop fieldable solutions to “Show what is possible” for future Toyota products. ', 'Responsibilities:', 'We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun environment with forward-thinking people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. Come work with TRI if you’re interested in transforming mobility through designing technology for safer cars, enabling the elderly to age in place, or designing alternative fuel sources. Start your impossible with us. ', 'Engineer big-data tools and pipelines to train, evaluate and deploy deep neural networks across TRI’s datasets ', '- Bring advanced mobility technology to market faster. ', 'Preferred MS/Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or an equivalent Mathematics field ', 'Help create new deep learning approaches and apply them to solve a plethora of real-world problems, such as driver intent prediction, agent prediction, etc. Work on crafting new pathways through TRI’s data stack for machine learning using AWS and other compute platforms Build smarter, more efficient ways of automating deep learning processes, including labeling, training, testing, and visualization Engineer big-data tools and pipelines to train, evaluate and deploy deep neural networks across TRI’s datasets Evaluate, adapt and apply popular deep learning frameworks for global, petabyte-scale use Developing tooling and infrastructure that support the launching and evaluating of planning and control algorithms Work with other engineers/scientists to implement fast reliable code ', 'The Risk Aware Driving team is focused on data-driven development using Toyota fleet logs and large-scale naturalistic driving datasets. Approaches from field robotics are then used to validate technologies for transition to more capable Toyota products. The team is developing technologies addressing all aspects of reasoning about driver behavior, including driver state estimation, prediction of road interactions, and quantification of risks. ', '- Discover new materials that will make batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. ', 'Evaluate, adapt and apply popular deep learning frameworks for global, petabyte-scale use ', 'Qualifications: ', 'Degree or 3+ years of industry experience ', '- Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ', 'Beneficial: Experience with C++ on a real-world robotic system, such as ROS development', 'Beneficial: Experience with “Naturalistic driving data” or customer datasets. ', 'At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll help… ', 'Responsibilities: ', ' ', 'Experience with production model deployment would be highly regarded. ', 'Experience with machine learning model training and refinement and optimization ', 'Degree or 3+ years of industry experience Preferred MS/Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or an equivalent Mathematics field Proven software engineering skills in C++ and/or Python Hands-on experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe, Keras, or Theano Hands-on experience with cloud frameworks such as AWS, GCP or Azure Experience with machine learning model training and refinement and optimization Experience with production model deployment would be highly regarded. Beneficial: A coder mentality eager to take research ideas to code. Beneficial: Experience with “Naturalistic driving data” or customer datasets. Beneficial: Experience with probabilistic robotics, Beneficial: Experience with computer vision and multiview geometry. Beneficial: Experience with autonomous vehicles, robot path planning Beneficial: Experience with C++ on a real-world robotic system, such as ROS development', 'Developing tooling and infrastructure that support the launching and evaluating of planning and control algorithms ', 'Work on crafting new pathways through TRI’s data stack for machine learning using AWS and other compute platforms ', '- Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ', 'Beneficial: Experience with probabilistic robotics, ', 'Beneficial: A coder mentality eager to take research ideas to code. ', 'Build smarter, more efficient ways of automating deep learning processes, including labeling, training, testing, and visualization ', '- Develop human-centered AI systems to augment (not replace) human decision making to increase the quality of decisions (e.g. mitigate cognitive biases) and/or to facilitate faster innovation cycles. ', 'As a software engineer on the Risk Aware Driving team, you will work to build models and software to understand driver behavior critical to advancing autonomous vehicle performance and road safety. ', 'Work with other engineers/scientists to implement fast reliable code ', 'Hands-on experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe, Keras, or Theano ', 'Qualifications:']

job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Big Data - Data Platform
job_text: ['', 'Basic Qualifications', ' You have the work and academic experience that will demonstrate proficiency and ease with programming', 'Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.', 'While you’ll have the skill to see and understand the big picture, you’re able to stay focused on the task at hand to achieve immediate goals.', 'Additional Information', 'As an end-end champion for your products, you will have strong debugging and Unix skills to help support our Operations teams.', 'You will build partnerships with product management to make sure that the products we are building deliver real value.', 'You have experience with Java,Scala, Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, Hive based technologies.', ' You will analyze business requirements and architect a solution that is robust and scalable along with', 'You have experience with Java,Scala, Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, Hive based technologies.You have strong experience with Agile development (scrum, Kanban etc) incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Maven, Jenkins.Ensure proper metrics instrumentation in software components, to help facilitate real time and remote troubleshooting/performance monitoring.Understand and own component security analysis, including code and data flow review. Collaborate with security team to implement and verify secure coding techniques.We count on your curiosity and creativity, to want to understand customer requirements and our processes and want to come up with creative solutions and improvements.While you’ll have the skill to see and understand the big picture, you’re able to stay focused on the task at hand to achieve immediate goals.You have proven experience to understand the requirements and independently, architect, design and build the solution.You have the passion to work with people and help mentor your juniors to reach new heights.As an end-end champion for your products, you will have strong debugging and Unix skills to help support our Operations teams.A background in the Reference Data domain knowledge.Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.', ' You’ll use technologies that include Java, Scala, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Pig and more.', 'Together', 'Ensure proper metrics instrumentation in software components, to help facilitate real time and remote troubleshooting/performance monitoring.', 'Company Description', ' You’ll lead meeting and discussions with cross-functional and non-technical teams.', 'Responsibilities', 'We count on your curiosity and creativity, to want to understand customer requirements and our processes and want to come up with creative solutions and improvements.', 'Job Description', ' You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and above all, you are a team player!', 'Travel Requirements', 'A background in the Reference Data domain knowledge.', ' Your DNA would include following and creating software best practices and processes.', 'You’ll lead efforts to architect, design and implement various components of our global transaction processing systems.', 'You have strong experience with Agile development (scrum, Kanban etc) incorporating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, utilizing technologies such as GIT, Maven, Jenkins.', ' You’ll leverage new technologies to build the next generation of Data pipelines and Data Marts.', 'Qualifications', 'Preferred Qualifications', "You're", 'You have the passion to work with people and help mentor your juniors to reach new heights.', 'Mental/Physical Requirements', ' You’ll help our customers achieve their real goals by understanding their requirements and how they', "We're", 'You have a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related field and 5+ years of Software Development Experience or at least 3 years of experience with a Masters in Computer science, Computer engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent field', 'Understand and own component security analysis, including code and data flow review. Collaborate with security team to implement and verify secure coding techniques.', 'You have proven experience to understand the requirements and independently, architect, design and build the solution.']

job_title: Site Reliability Engineer - TS/SCI with POLY
job_text: ['', 'Administer SaaS / cloud-based solutions like OpenShift or Kubernetes that deploy and orchestrate containerized applications. ', 'Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication skills. ', '\xa0 ', "As a Site Reliability Engineer, you’ll work to maintain cloud services performing at levels both promised and expected by our external customer base.  You'll work in a highly collaborative environment deploying, monitoring, and maintaining systems hosting our IaaS model.  This role is an office-based position in the Washington D.C or RTP, NC areas.  This position includes on-call work due to the critical nature of the services we support.", 'Education', "Administer NetApp remote and cloud-based storage solutions.  Assist with capacity planning to ensure continuous performance expectations are met. Automate repetitive and error prone tasks and processes, using tools like Docker, GitLab, Ansible, Python, Bash and other scripting languages. Administer SaaS / cloud-based solutions like OpenShift or Kubernetes that deploy and orchestrate containerized applications. Ensure adequate monitoring is in place and enhance or adjust where needed, using tools like Observium, ElasticSearch, Prometheus in addition to proprietary NetApp monitoring solutions and home-grown scripts / automation.  You'll continuously measure the availability, latency and overall system health. Secure our environment from security threats deploying patches and least-privilege configurations. Respond to incidents and drive change preventing issues from re-occurring. You will also look for opportunities to automate the recovery for certain incidents that may be difficult to prevent. \xa0 You will use Atlassian Jira to track issues to resolution based on their priority. Design and implement tools for automated deployment and monitoring of multiple environments. Document findings and solutions you create using Atlassian Confluence as well as well-documented automation. ", 'A basic understanding of public cloud vendors such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud or others. ', 'Are you data-driven?  We at NetApp believe in the transformative power of data – to expand customer touchpoints, to foster greater innovation, and to optimize operations.  We are designed for simplicity, optimized to protect, created to embrace future opportunity, and open to enrich choice.  We are the data authority for hybrid cloud, and we are helping our customers realize the full potential of their data.', 'DoD TS/SCI security clearance required You are generally curious and highly motivated with a passion for ensuring scalable and highly available solutions. Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication skills. You are great at solving problems, sorting meaningful information from noise, and taking action. Familiarity with operating systems such as Linux, CentOS, Ubuntu and Windows. A basic understanding of at least one scripting language similar to Bash, Python, or Pearl, Ruby. A basic understanding of public cloud vendors such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud or others. A Bachelor of Science Degree is preferred. ', 'Administer NetApp remote and cloud-based storage solutions.  Assist with capacity planning to ensure continuous performance expectations are met.', '\xa0', 'Key Characteristics', 'Document findings and solutions you create using Atlassian Confluence as well as well-documented automation. ', 'You are great at solving problems, sorting meaningful information from noise, and taking action. ', 'Administer NetApp remote and cloud-based storage solutions.  Assist with capacity planning to ensure continuous performance expectations are met. ', 'Site Reliability Engineer ', 'Job Summary ', 'A Bachelor of Science Degree is preferred.', 'A basic understanding of at least one scripting language similar to Bash, Python, or Pearl, Ruby. ', 'Duties and Responsibilities ', 'A basic understanding of public cloud vendors such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud or others.', 'Automate repetitive and error prone tasks and processes, using tools like Docker, GitLab, Ansible, Python, Bash and other scripting languages.', 'Are you data-driven?  We at NetApp believe in the transformative power of data – to expand customer touchpoints, to foster greater innovation, and to optimize operations.  We are designed for simplicity, optimized to protect, created to embrace future opportunity, and open to enrich choice.  We are the data authority for hybrid cloud, and we are helping our customers realize the full potential of their data. ', 'Respond to incidents and drive change preventing issues from re-occurring. You will also look for opportunities to automate the recovery for certain incidents that may be difficult to prevent. \xa0 You will use Atlassian Jira to track issues to resolution based on their priority.', "Ensure adequate monitoring is in place and enhance or adjust where needed, using tools like Observium, ElasticSearch, Prometheus in addition to proprietary NetApp monitoring solutions and home-grown scripts / automation.  You'll continuously measure the availability, latency and overall system health.", 'Job Summary', 'Secure our environment from security threats deploying patches and least-privilege configurations. ', 'DoD TS/SCI security clearance required', 'Duties and Responsibilities', 'We’ve built a Data Fabric for a data-driven world – to simplify and integrate data management across the resources that are best for the business.  With the Data Fabric, our customers can harness the power of cloud data services, build cloud infrastructures, and modernize storage through data management. ', 'Familiarity with operating systems such as Linux, CentOS, Ubuntu and Windows. ', 'We’ve built a Data Fabric for a data-driven world – to simplify and integrate data management across the resources that are best for the business.  With the Data Fabric, our customers can harness the power of cloud data services, build cloud infrastructures, and modernize storage through data management.', 'You are generally curious and highly motivated with a passion for ensuring scalable and highly available solutions. ', 'Key Characteristics ', 'A basic understanding of at least one scripting language similar to Bash, Python, or Pearl, Ruby.', 'Familiarity with operating systems such as Linux, CentOS, Ubuntu and Windows.', 'DoD TS/SCI security clearance required ', ' ', 'Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication skills.', 'Document findings and solutions you create using Atlassian Confluence as well as well-documented automation.', 'Education ', "As a Site Reliability Engineer, you’ll work to maintain cloud services performing at levels both promised and expected by our external customer base.  You'll work in a highly collaborative environment deploying, monitoring, and maintaining systems hosting our IaaS model.  This role is an office-based position in the Washington D.C or RTP, NC areas.  This position includes on-call work due to the critical nature of the services we support. ", 'Typically requires a minimum 5 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience. ', "Ensure adequate monitoring is in place and enhance or adjust where needed, using tools like Observium, ElasticSearch, Prometheus in addition to proprietary NetApp monitoring solutions and home-grown scripts / automation.  You'll continuously measure the availability, latency and overall system health. ", 'Secure our environment from security threats deploying patches and least-privilege configurations.', 'Automate repetitive and error prone tasks and processes, using tools like Docker, GitLab, Ansible, Python, Bash and other scripting languages. ', 'Respond to incidents and drive change preventing issues from re-occurring. You will also look for opportunities to automate the recovery for certain incidents that may be difficult to prevent. \xa0 You will use Atlassian Jira to track issues to resolution based on their priority. ', 'Typically requires a minimum 5 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience.', 'A Bachelor of Science Degree is preferred. ', 'Site Reliability Engineer', 'You are generally curious and highly motivated with a passion for ensuring scalable and highly available solutions.', 'Design and implement tools for automated deployment and monitoring of multiple environments. ', 'Administer SaaS / cloud-based solutions like OpenShift or Kubernetes that deploy and orchestrate containerized applications.', 'Design and implement tools for automated deployment and monitoring of multiple environments.', 'You are great at solving problems, sorting meaningful information from noise, and taking action.']

['', "We're a small team tackling the absolutely massive mortgage market. We're bringing modern, elegant software to a field that still relies on fax machines and manila envelopes. We bring security, efficiency and joy to a paper-based pillar of the US economy.", 'Snapdocs’ culture is one that strongly values diversity and drive. We want to work with people of different backgrounds and different paths in life, and we trust our team members to make smart decisions. We value independent work as well as collaboration. Snapdocs provides a range of excellent benefits ranging from the standard stuff: matching 401(k), free lunches, and 21 days PTO to the not so standard—like a 10 year exercise window on your options.', 'As a Senior Software Engineer you will play a central role in the development of high-volume, low-latency applications for mission-critical business systems. You will own the design, build, and maintenance of APIs, backend services, and distributed systems. In addition to contributing to core services, you will build new tools for our in-house Quality Control team & even lend a helping hand to debug production issues across services when the need arises. You will work with product and engineering teams to release at a high velocity and contribute in all phases of the SDLC. We expect you to lead by example, improve engineering standards, live best practices and create processes that enable our team to build world class software for an industry in need of change.\xa0', 'The type of problems we focus on involve workflow, product design, and data. Monolith vs microservice is an ongoing debate. We are working to find a good authentication pattern that allows for people to work across companies in multiple roles (which is trickier than you might think!). Domain Driven Design is our guiding light.', "Ideally, over the past 7+ years you have gained\xa0mastery of at least one of these: Ruby, Go, Scala, Java (or any Object-Oriented programming language). Self identified polyglots fit well within our team. You have seen scale in your time; solving a diverse range of problems in both start ups and large organizations. Your years in the trenches enable you to work at scale with complex distributed systems & relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc) easily and effectively. Today our team is working in Ruby on Rails, React, Postgres, AWS, Docker, & Kubernetes to name a few but things change quickly so be comfortable learning new tools. We take a pragmatic approach to programming language experience and believe languages can be learned so don't get too hung up if you have not worked with our tools. Learning new languages is a challenge that excites you. Prior experience working with a geographically distributed and/or remote teams in the past will be plus as you will be working collaboratively with our San Francisco based engineering team on a daily basis.\xa0", 'Hello Denver! We are excited to be here!', "We trust our team members to make smart decisions. This means we value both independent work as well as collaboration. We're becoming ubiquitous in one segment of the market and now we're looking to hire another core engineer to help us expand further.", 'Snapdocs is expanding & hiring for our first Denver Engineering team members. If you’re excited by the idea of joining the founding team responsible for backend development, playing an instrumental role in building and shaping the Denver office culture for a fast-growth startup then you should check out this role.\xa0']

['Must have commercial experience with Python and Docker, and either Sagemaker/Azure/GCP ', 'THE ROLEResponsibilities', 'Extensive experience deploying microservices in a production environment where the past few years have been specifically to put Machine Learning/Deep Learning models into production Must have commercial experience with Python and Docker, and either Sagemaker/Azure/GCP Commercial experience with AWS, Spark, Airflow are preferred\xa0 ', 'You will be using a tech stack of Python, Docker, and AWS in order to maintain a continuous integration/continuous delivery environment ', 'Your Skills And ExperienceIn order to be considered for the Machine Learning Production Engineer position, you are someone with the following background:\xa0 ', 'THE ROLEResponsibilitiesSpecifically, their long-term mission and expansion plan centers around these key responsibilitiesAs the Machine Learning Production Engineer, you will be integral to the overall market impact of the business.\xa0 ', 'The Benefits ', 'PTO and Vacation Days ', 'How To ApplyPlease register your interest by sending your résumé to Elizabeth Sobel via the Apply link on this page.', 'You will be the first hire on the production side with a clear path to a management opportunity\xa0 ', 'How To Apply', 'Machine Learning Production EngineerBoston, MA$140,000-$155,000 + Great Benefits', 'Machine Learning Production EngineerBoston, MA$140,000-$155,000 + Great BenefitsThis labor market expert business is looking to bring on a Machine Learning Production Engineer to their Boston, Massachusetts headquarters in order to support their Data Science team in their end data product line. This is an opportunity for a Production Engineer to join a strong data science team that can hit the ground running doing machine-learning ops. This position calls for someone who is tested and well versed putting microservices into production, and likes working closely with data science functions. This could be a great opportunity for you with massive growth potential. ', '$140,000-$155,000 annual salary Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits 401K PTO and Vacation Days Direct mentorship/training opportunities are offered as desired Autonomy and full product ownership\xa0 ', '401K ', 'Commercial experience with AWS, Spark, Airflow are preferred\xa0 ', 'Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits ', 'Direct mentorship/training opportunities are offered as desired ', 'Autonomy and full product ownership\xa0 ', 'Your Skills And Experience', 'You will be in charge of putting microservices from 3rd party APIs into production ', 'You will be collaborating extremely closely with the data scientists to enable ready to use data for creating algorithms and end data products for clients ', 'Extensive experience deploying microservices in a production environment where the past few years have been specifically to put Machine Learning/Deep Learning models into production ', '$140,000-$155,000 annual salary ', 'You will be collaborating extremely closely with the data scientists to enable ready to use data for creating algorithms and end data products for clients You will be in charge of putting microservices from 3rd party APIs into production You will be using a tech stack of Python, Docker, and AWS in order to maintain a continuous integration/continuous delivery environment You will be the first hire on the production side with a clear path to a management opportunity\xa0 ', 'The Benefits']

job_title: Lead Software Engineer, Unity Team Tools and Services
job_text: ['', 'About Unity Technologies', 'Experience with our stack (Node.js, Golang, Postgres, C#, GCP, Kubernetes) is helpful, but not required - we are looking for great people that have a track record of solving problems in similar domains', 'Directly manage engineers, providing feedback and guidance', 'Experience mentoring engineers to improve their skills and make them more effective', 'Solid programming skills in your favorite language, even if it isn’t our own', 'Work closely with project and product managers to ensure our products provide a consistently great experience across all cloud services', 'Working knowledge of the Unity game engine', 'Requirements', 'Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full development life cycle (coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, operations, etc.)', 'Maintain clear and effective communication within the team and out to the broader organization', 'Significant technical experience leading engineers through all phases of development', 'Responsibilities', ' #SEN', 'Game industry experience', 'Operate within a distributed team, collaborating with colleagues around the world', 'Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.', ' Working knowledge of the Unity game engine Game industry experience Experience working with various cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure Experience with DevOps (deployment, monitoring, automation, etc.) Experience with our stack (Node.js, Golang, Postgres, C#, GCP, Kubernetes) is helpful, but not required - we are looking for great people that have a track record of solving problems in similar domains ', 'Experience with DevOps (deployment, monitoring, automation, etc.)', 'Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.', 'Bonus Points', 'Experience working with various cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure', ' Directly manage engineers, providing feedback and guidance Maintain clear and effective communication within the team and out to the broader organization Work closely with project and product managers to ensure our products provide a consistently great experience across all cloud services Operate within a distributed team, collaborating with colleagues around the world ', ' Solid programming skills in your favorite language, even if it isn’t our own Significant technical experience leading engineers through all phases of development Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full development life cycle (coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, operations, etc.) Experience mentoring engineers to improve their skills and make them more effective ']

job_title: Staff Data Engineer - World Wide Publishing Technology
job_text: ['', 'Our Perks', 'Experience with Google Cloud data ecosystem including BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloudrun, and BigTable', 'Experience implementing data solutions in public cloud technologies including configuration and deployment', ' Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable experience 6+ years experience in Python, Scala, Java, or similar data processing programming language 3+ years experience with Spark, Hadoop, or Databricks Experience influencing engineering best practices within your team, including design/code reviews, coding standards, source control management, build processes, and testing Experience working collaboratively across multiple teams and customers to accomplish deliverables Experience with data analysis, processing, and validation Experience with SQL, databases, and data pipelining technologies and ETL frameworks Experience implementing data solutions in public cloud technologies including configuration and deployment Experiencing as a leader in making technical decisions (for example: served as Technical Lead across multiple teams) Strong communication and collaboration skills ', 'Experience working collaboratively across multiple teams and customers to accomplish deliverables', '3+ years experience with Spark, Hadoop, or Databricks', 'Experience working with analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Singular MMP', 'Desired Qualifications', 'Responsibilities', ' Experience working with analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Singular MMP Experience working with digital media and cross-device data from major networks like Facebook and Google Ads Experience with CRM or CDP platforms like Salesforce Marketing Cloud Experience with Google Cloud data ecosystem including BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloudrun, and BigTable ', '6+ years experience in Python, Scala, Java, or similar data processing programming language', ' Owner for technical strategy, architecture, and implementation of the WWP MarTech platform Design and build tools that provide confidence in our data quality. You will create and oversee mature development processes and systems (i.e. automated tests, staged deployments) to validate our data is always flowing and correctly Create and implement scalable data models & schemas that power use cases such as predictive data models, advanced reporting and insights, and supporting our customer needs in user acquisition, WWP publishing, & game marketing teams. You will help identify important questions and then provide services, datasets, and tools that empower them to find the answers Help developers select data technologies that provide efficient insights with a high return on investment Provide technical leadership and mentor data & software engineers on the WWP Tech team ', 'Owner for technical strategy, architecture, and implementation of the WWP MarTech platform', 'Experience with SQL, databases, and data pipelining technologies and ETL frameworks', 'Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable experience', 'Experience with CRM or CDP platforms like Salesforce Marketing Cloud', 'Design and build tools that provide confidence in our data quality. You will create and oversee mature development processes and systems (i.e. automated tests, staged deployments) to validate our data is always flowing and correctly', 'Help developers select data technologies that provide efficient insights with a high return on investment', 'Experiencing as a leader in making technical decisions (for example: served as Technical Lead across multiple teams)', 'Create and implement scalable data models & schemas that power use cases such as predictive data models, advanced reporting and insights, and supporting our customer needs in user acquisition, WWP publishing, & game marketing teams. You will help identify important questions and then provide services, datasets, and tools that empower them to find the answers', 'Experience influencing engineering best practices within your team, including design/code reviews, coding standards, source control management, build processes, and testing', 'Provide technical leadership and mentor data & software engineers on the WWP Tech team', 'Required Qualifications', "It’s our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and members of Riot Games, Inc. Riot Games makes reasonable accommodations for handicapped and disabled Rioters and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, handicap, veteran status, marital status, criminal history, or any other category protected by applicable federal and state law, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance relating to an applicant's criminal history (LAMC 189.00).", 'Experience with data analysis, processing, and validation', 'Experience working with digital media and cross-device data from major networks like Facebook and Google Ads', 'Strong communication and collaboration skills', ' Data Engineer III on the WWP Technology team']

As a company that heavily relies on cutting-edge IT operations to serve its members, ASH is seeking ambitious individuals with a strong team mentality and a genuine passion for software engineering.\xa0Join a company where programming design and quality is expected, appreciated, and nurtured.', 'Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP\xa0here.\xa0', 'Paid personal time off to be used for vacation, sick time, etc.', 'Flexible health care spending account', 'Software training classes', 'The safety of our employees, both current and future, is ASH’s highest priority. At this time, most of our employees are working remotely due to the current COVID-19 pandemic. Candidates who are selected for this position will be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area with company-provided technology equipment. Once ASH determines employees can return the office, candidates may be required to work in a local office. Limited visits to the office in person may be required. ['', 'Participate daily standup team meeting/bi-weekly sprint planning & sprint-end demo/retrospective and work cross-functionality with other teams in Lattice to drive the innovations of our products.', 'We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!', 'Contribute to and lead the continuous improvement of the software development framework and processes by analyzing, designing and developing test cases and implementing automated test suites.', 'Responsible for leading the design and development of a Big Data predictive analytics SaaS based customer data platform using object oriented analysis, design and programming skills, and design patterns', 'Strong analytical and problem solving skills.', 'Hands-on experience with Java & Spring BootPast Lead experience requiredStrong expertise with 3+ years of experience in building enterprise techniques for large scale distributed system design and data processing.Strong knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, Object Oriented programming and design.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Ability to hit the ground running and learn/adapt quickly.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsSelf-driven, willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment,BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Master degree is preferred.Desired: Hands-on experience with Docker, Hadoop, Cascading, Spark, AWS, DyanmoDB, Redshift, Redis, Akka, or similar technologies.', 'BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Master degree is preferred.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills', 'Ability to lead a SCRUM team of at least 6 members of Engineering', 'Education/Experience and Competencies:', 'Strong knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, Object Oriented programming and design.', 'Reproduce, troubleshoot and determine root cause of production issues', 'Team Overview:', 'Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet', 'Responsible for leading the effort of continuously improving reliability, scalability, and stability of micro services and platform.', 'Past Lead experience required', 'Strong expertise with 3+ years of experience in building enterprise techniques for large scale distributed system design and data processing.', 'Self-driven, willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment,', 'Desired: Hands-on experience with Docker, Hadoop, Cascading, Spark, AWS, DyanmoDB, Redshift, Redis, Akka, or similar technologies.', 'Ability to lead a SCRUM team of at least 6 members of EngineeringResponsible for leading the design and development of a Big Data predictive analytics SaaS based customer data platform using object oriented analysis, design and programming skills, and design patternsResponsible for leading the effort of continuously improving reliability, scalability, and stability of micro services and platform.Contribute to and lead the continuous improvement of the software development framework and processes by analyzing, designing and developing test cases and implementing automated test suites.Reproduce, troubleshoot and determine root cause of production issuesParticipate daily standup team meeting/bi-weekly sprint planning & sprint-end demo/retrospective and work cross-functionality with other teams in Lattice to drive the innovations of our products.', 'Hands-on experience with Java & Spring Boot', 'You will be joining a team focused on development for our industry-leading, highly scalable, SaaS based Customer Data Platform, D&B Lattice. This team is expanding quickly to tackle exciting challenges with our core products involving “Big Data” predictive analytics, reporting, querying, and data processing & management leveraging distributed design and data processing technology such as Hadoop/Spark. Your work will be vital to solidifying D&B Lattice as the leading Customer Data Platform and expanding our reach to new markets. The current team consists of experienced professionals with background from top schools (such as Harvard, MIT, Stanford, Tsinghua, UC Berkeley, U Penn, etc.) & top software/tech companies & successful startups (such as Apple, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, ServiceNow, VMware, Zoom, etc.), who have proven their aptitude for delivering robust solutions for our customers using the latest technology, and they are looking for fellow engineers who are excited about technology, learning, and shipping products to join them.', 'Ability to hit the ground running and learn/adapt quickly.', 'Key Responsibilities:']

job_title: Lead Software Engineer | Next Gen Trading Platform | Top Hedge Fund
job_text: ['BS Degree or higher in Computer Science/Engineering; or other technical disciplineExperience designing and leading end-to-end development life-cycle processes5+ years of experience using C#/.NET2+ years of experience with Azure or AWS', 'Experience designing and leading end-to-end development life-cycle processes', '2+ years of experience with Azure or AWS', '\xa0', 'Lead Software Engineer | Next Gen Trading Platform | Top Hedge Fund', 'Take overall ownership of architecture, implementation, and delivery', 'Your opportunity:', 'Your Skills and Talents:', "Step into this firm's highest impact role by taking overall ownership of a Top Hedge Fund's premier trading platform", 'BS Degree or higher in Computer Science/Engineering; or other technical discipline', 'Design and build end to end solutions for a cutting-edge trading platform', 'An Elite Trading Firm, based in Boston, MA, is building out a new, high-visibility trading platform. They have an opportunity for a Lead Software Engineer to take ownership of this next generation trading platform. This lean, niche firm has a reputation for being particularly innovative, and their new platform will rely heavily on Cloud Computing and Machine Learning. They are owned and backed by an extremely well-known Fortune 50 company, but have the technical flexibility of a niche start up.', '5+ years of experience using C#/.NET', "Design and build end to end solutions for a cutting-edge trading platformTake overall ownership of architecture, implementation, and deliveryStep into this firm's highest impact role by taking overall ownership of a Top Hedge Fund's premier trading platform", 'As a Lead Software Engineer, you will apply your deep expertise in software engineering and architecture to design and build a new suite of tools for their traders. You will collaborate directly with these business users to identify areas of potential innovation, gather requirements, and implement new features in an iterative process.']

['', 'You are involved in building and optimizing our own Bear Operating Systems, an infrastructure to control and monitor our globally deployed robots. You are building the remote monitoring, record-replay as well as resource scheduling. When it comes to distributed computing, you lead the way in your team and are the go-to expert in regards of system design and architecture. No matter if it is backend or frontend - you own the system full stack like no other. Furthermore, you enjoy driving optimization strategies and realizing ambiguous work streams. Your organization skills, go-getter personality and people-focussed mentality are the right tools to grow into a tech lead role.', 'Required Skills:\xa0\xa0Git, NoSQL, Networking, Google Cloud, ReactJs, NodeJs, Gevent, Docker, Cordova', 'Bear Robotics was started in 2017 to address the increased pressure faced by the food service industry around wages, labor supply, and cost efficiencies. Our company has developed a robot named Penny enabled by artificial intelligence and able to autonomously shuttle food from a kitchen out to tables and bring dishes back for cleaning. If you want to dive into deep-tech with an A+ team, Bear Robotics is a perfect place for you.', 'BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering\xa0', 'Strong knowledge and solid hands-on experience of full stack system\xa0', 'Your role & responsibilities:', 'Experience in Git, NoSQL, Networking, Google Cloud, ReactJs, NodeJs, Gevent, Docker, Cordova and/or Linux', 'Company Description:', 'Proven skills in distributed system design and architecture\xa0', 'Minimum Qualifications:', 'BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering\xa0Strong knowledge and solid hands-on experience of full stack system\xa0Proven skills in distributed system design and architecture\xa0Experience in Git, NoSQL, Networking, Google Cloud, ReactJs, NodeJs, Gevent, Docker, Cordova and/or Linux']
